technology.short_description: A piece of armour is no harder than the anvil upon which it is fashioned.

effects.description: Armour: +5 for Marauder Infantry units

technology.short_description: With the right armour, a Marauder’s mare can trample several enemy lines before taking significant damage.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Marauder Chariot & Marauder Cavalry units
Melee defence: +4 for Marauder Chariot and Marauder Cavalry units

technology.short_description: Trolls aren't particularly bright, but they do understand that the first to the feast is the first to eat.

effects.description: Speed: +20% for all Troll units

technology.short_description: Easier to eat when they're dead.

effects.description: Ability: "Waaagh!" for all Troll units

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee (150s)

technology.short_description: From afar, let us watch the sweet flame engulf their precious tree-kin!

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Wood Elves
Missile resistance: 10% when fighting against Wood Elves
Unit experience gain: +100% for units when fighting against Wood Elves

technology.short_description: Betwixt pine and bark but ash now lay knowledge innate to the Wood Elves – ours for the taking.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
Attribute: Causes Fear when ambushing

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

effects.description: Attribute: Strider for Marauder infantry units

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

technology.short_description: Weapons and armour are not the only apparatus of war – so too are the tools used to forge them.

effects.description: Leadership: +4 for Marauder units

technology.short_description: Without their aptly-formed instruments of death, the Northmen would be much less effective killers.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Marauder Infantry units

technology.short_description: The correct expertise and equipment enables the Marauders' swift, blood-fed steeds to be ridden at their greatest speeds.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Marauder Chariot & Marauder Cavalry units
Charge bonus: +20% for Marauder Chariot & Marauder Cavalry units

technology.short_description: When Throgg calls, the mightiest creatures are drawn to his authority.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1 for Norscan Trolls & Norscan Ice Trolls units
Recruit rank: +1 for Fimir units

technology.short_description: Throgg understands the base instincts of such creatures.

effects.description: Speed: +20% for Fimir units

technology.short_description: Ever clever of mind, Throgg whispers of the return to the Dark Gods' favour.

effects.description: Ability: "Frenzy" for Fimir units

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

technology.short_description: Svengar’s defeat at L’Anguille was an age ago - the Bretonnian Dukes shall soon fall!

effects.description: Leadership: +4 when fighting against Bretonnia
Bonus vs Large: +4 when fighting against Bretonnia
Unit experience gain: +100% for units when fighting against Bretonnia

technology.short_description: The lavish lands of Bretonnia’s capital provide powerful steeds, fertile lands, and tradable resources in abundance.

effects.description: Income from trade tariffs: +200%
Growth: +20
Charge bonus: +10% for Cavalry units

technology.short_description: The arrogance of these Elves, they think they know how to deal pain? We shall show them true pain!

effects.description: Melee defence: +4 when fighting against Dark Elves
Missile resistance: 10% when fighting against Dark Elves
Unit experience gain: +100% for units when fighting against Dark Elves

technology.short_description: With sorcerous secrets revealed, the Balefiends will be drawn - like moths to a flame.

effects.description: When normally killed in action, your Heroes will be wounded instead
Income from raiding: +25%
Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Norscan Giant, Chaos Frost Dragon and Mammoth units
Hero capacity: +2 for Fimir Balefiends

technology.short_description: Sharper throwing-axes forged in larger numbers mean more dismemberment and decapitation on the battlefield.

effects.description: Ammunition: +10% for Marauder Missile units
Missile strength: +10% for Marauder Missile units

technology.short_description: Give a captive a sword and he becomes an expendable sparring partner.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Marauder units
Melee defence: +4 for Marauder units

technology.short_description: You know nothing. Throgg knows much.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 when fighting against Norsca
Melee defence: +4 when fighting against Norsca

technology.short_description: Trolls don't have a particularly robust attention span. Best to be brief.

effects.description: Ability: "Norse Roar" for Throgg

target_if: Not on or below a platform

technology.short_description: The opulent, pompous kingdoms of men and Dwarfs sit on a vast wealth that waits to be taken.

effects.description: Replenishes 5% campaign movement range after razing a settlement
Income from sacking settlements: +20% (Wood Elf, Bretonnian, Southern Kingdom & Dwarf settlements)

technology.short_description: The peaceful principalities of the southernmost men need to be shown the true savagery of the north!

effects.description: Income from post-battle loot: +5%
Leadership: +4 when fighting against Tilea
Missile resistance: 10% when fighting against Tilea

technology.short_description: Whether it is material wealth, or just good ideas, all manner of assets can be stolen from organised men.

effects.description: Research rate: +25
Income from Ports: +10%
Global recruitment capacity: +1

technology.short_description: The only fit fate for these preening, foppish beanpoles is to be cut, cleaved and butchered.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 when fighting against High Elves
Spell resistance: 15% when fighting against High Elves
Unit experience gain: +100% for units when fighting against High Elves

technology.short_description: Steal from the Elves the things that which makes them ‘worthy’; their methods of subterfuge, their machinations of intrigue.

effects.description: Hero action success chance: +5%
Missile strength: +10%
Spell resistance: 10%

technology.short_description: Sailing into the unknown is always easier with more space for supplies.

effects.description: Immune to High Seas attrition

technology.short_description: Entrenched in their Holds, the stunties fiercely protect their lucrative mines, offering both a good fight and valuable plunder.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dwarfs
Leadership: +5 during subterranean intercept battles
Unit experience gain: +100% for units when fighting against Dwarfs

technology.short_description: The closely-guarded knowledge of Dwarf construction and resource excavation techniques will be mysterious no longer!

effects.description: Construction cost: -20% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
Income from Province Capital/Settlement buildings: +20%

technology.short_description: Hunt the cold-bloods, defile their sacred spaces, pillage and take all we can!

effects.description: Income from post-battle loot: +5%
Leadership: +8 for Marauder units when fighting against Lizardmen
Bonus vs Large: +4 when fighting against Lizardmen

technology.short_description: Take from the reptiles all they hold dear - their precious secrets.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
Lord recruit rank: +4
Upkeep: -10% for Mammoth, Skin Wolf, Norscan Ice Wolves and Norscan Warhounds units
Physical resistance: 5% for Marauder Infantry units

technology.short_description: Let them feel the hammer not on anvil, but on flesh. Let the molten industry be consumed by flame!

effects.description: Armour: +5 for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Berserkers and Marauder Champions units

Ward save: 10% when fighting against Chaos Dwarfs
	(all characters factionwide)
Unit experience gain: +100% for units when fighting against Chaos Dwarfs

technology.short_description: Let us claim the secrets of the well-oiled machine of industry for our own, the Chaos Dwarfs won’t be needing it anymore…

effects.description: Construction cost: -20% for Military Support and Economy buildings
Global recruitment duration: -1 turn for all units
Income from all buildings: +10%

technology.short_description: Nowhere else but under the shadow of Chaos are such brutish and degenerate killers nurtured and bred.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Norscan Trolls, Norscan Ice Trolls & Fimir Warrior units
Charge bonus: +10% for Norscan Trolls, Norscan Ice Trolls & Fimir Warriors units

technology.short_description: Prolonged exposure to the dark energies of the bitter, frozen north creates the toughest and most monstrous freaks.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Fimir units
Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for all Troll units

technology.short_description: Throgg's gift of intelligence marks him as favoured by the Chaos Gods.

effects.description:
Chaos Undivided corruption: +4
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: Gifts for the dark masters.

effects.description: Casualties captured post-battle: +50%

technology.short_description: Whether fighting at sea or on land, the longship Marauders are the most seasoned veterans of the Norscan tribes.

effects.description: Replenishes 5% campaign movement range after razing a settlement

technology.short_description: When the Marauders’ eagerness for despoilment is nurtured, vast distances can be covered between raids.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: +25% for armies
	(all navies)

technology.short_description: Every new war brings the Marauders bloody, gore-drenched glory in battle, whether in victory or in death.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -10% for Marauder Infantry units
Enable recruitment: Blessed Marauder Champions units

technology.short_description: Like an unspoilt bauble waiting to be ravaged and plundered, the New World beckons.

effects.description: Replenishes 5% campaign movement range after razing a settlement
Income from sacking settlements: +20% (Dark Elf, High Elf, Lizardmen, Skaven, Tomb King & Vampire Coast settlements)

technology.short_description: Scorched wastelands, winding rivers and a great toothed wound in the earth lie beyond the old Dwarfholds.

effects.description: Replenishes 5% campaign movement range after razing a settlement
Income from sacking settlements: +20% (Cathay, Chaos Dwarf & Ogre Kingdom settlements)

technology.short_description: Let them build their Bastion; let them muster their pampered peoples. In time, all shall be rubble and corpses.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -10% when fighting against Cathay
Missile resistance: 10% when fighting against Cathay
Unit experience gain: +100% for units when fighting against Cathay

technology.short_description: Take from them their iron fist and make it your own!

Leadership aura size: +50%

Passive ability: "Tactician"
	(all characters factionwide)

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

technology.short_description: For those who dwell in the shadow of Chaos, monster hunting is a most savage pleasure.

effects.description: Unlocks level 1 Monster Hunts
Physical resistance: 5% for Norscan Warhounds and Norsca Ice Wolves units

technology.short_description: For some abominations of the north, a mere whiff of blood is enough to lose all restraint.

Weapon strength: +10% for Skin Wolf, Norscan Ice Wolves & Norscan Warhounds units

technology.short_description: The eerie green glow of the Dark Moon calls out all manner of feral monstrosities from the Norscan wilderness.

Speed: +10% for Norscan Warhounds and Norsca Ice Wolves units
Missile resistance: 10% for all Skin Wolves units

technology.short_description: You should probably... do that.

effects.description: Control: +2

technology.short_description: Throgg's monstrous subjects possess monstrous appetites.

Growth: -10

Growth per region: +10 after winning a battle
	(all provinces)

technology.short_description: When Troll Country descends upon the soft, weak South, a new ice age will dawn.

effects.description: Armies replenish in foreign territory

technology.short_description: “Once you’ve rowed the breadth of the Middle Sea a few times, relentless slaughter does little to tire you…”

effects.description: Character experience gain: +10%

technology.short_description: The soft men of the Empire think themselves the pinnacle of civilisation – time to bring them down a notch!

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Marauder units
Leadership aura size: +50% when fighting against Empire

technology.short_description: Despoil the Empire’s heartland, rip the Colleges of Magic from their foundations – only then will their secrets be revealed.

Weapon strength: +10%

technology.short_description: Slaughter the ratmen - the step-children of our Dark Lords. We are the true inheritors!

technology.short_description: The vile secrets of the Skaven - their devious designs - are ripe for plunder.

effects.description: Chance of a plague spreading: -25%
Campaign line of sight: +50%
Recruitment cost: -10% for all units

technology.short_description: So fat and satisfied – their dedication to the Great Maw blinds them from the truth marching to their mawstep.

effects.description: Melee attack: +2 when attacking
Bonus vs Large: +4 when fighting against Ogres
Unit experience gain: +100% for units when fighting against Ogres

technology.short_description: From high peaks to valley depths cradles knowledge foreign to our own – but tried and useful nonetheless.

effects.description: Replenishes 10% campaign movement range after winning a battle

Hero capacity: +2 for Shaman-Sorcerers

technology.short_description: A hunter without knowledge of his quarry is like a warrior without knowledge of his enemy.

effects.description: Unlocks level 2 Monster Hunts

Melee attack: +4 for Manticore and Chaos Frost Dragon units

technology.short_description: “To kill the beast, you must think like the beast."

technology.short_description: Fortunately, trolls are too stupid to be corrupt or dishonest.

technology.short_description: The King demands his share.

effects.description: Income from post-battle loot: +10%

technology.short_description: To the east lie lands ripe for plundering – the treasuries and loot piles of Empire-men, Vampires, and Greenskins.

effects.description: Replenishes 5% campaign movement range after razing a settlement
Income from sacking settlements: +20% (Empire, Kislev, Vampire Count & Greenskin settlements)

technology.short_description: Clogging up the land with soulless vessels, the Vampires and their Necromantic allies are a scourge to be eradicated.

effects.description: Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from Vampiric territory attrition
Melee defence: +4 when fighting against Vampire Counts
Unit experience gain: +100% for units when fighting against Vampire Counts

technology.short_description: The Vampires and Undead, while despicable, are masters of subterfuge and know the secrets of mortal convalescence.

effects.description: Enemy Hero action success chance: -10%
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%

technology.short_description: Deserts are for the dead, but the tomb-lurkers insist they live. Show them the truth.

effects.description: Immune to Desert attrition

Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Tomb Kings

technology.short_description: Within their tombs is knowledge as ancient as the Dark Masters, take it.

effects.description: When normally killed in action, your Lords will be wounded instead

technology.short_description: The Greenskins’ love for war almost matches that of the Norscan tribes – let savagery be met with savagery!

effects.description: Immune to Barren Wasteland attrition

technology.short_description: The primitive Greenskin gods are hard to make sense of, but their mystical secrets are valuable to any warmonger.

effects.description: Immune to Climate, Sea, Corruption and Storm attrition

technology.short_description: The war never ends because combatants slain are rarely dead for long...

technology.short_description: The Vampire Coast's vast hoards of stolen treasure shall be yours. The gold, maps and logs within will bring you advantage.

technology.short_description: They merely adopted the cold – we were born in it, molded by it.

technology.short_description: Let nothing remain of us but the ice in our hearts.
